data.title: Ariana
data.meta_description: What is the meaning of the name Ariana? Discover the origin, popularity, Ariana name meaning, and names related to Ariana with Mama Natural’s fantastic baby names guide.
data.text:
Ariana Name Origin: Latin

Pronunciation: ahr-ee-ah-nah

See what 8 people think about Ariana

Ariana Name Meaning

A Latin name meaning “most holy,” Ariana has been a shining star with parents in recent years. She has a sing-songy feel that extends beyond her pop star association.

Ariana has been on the upswing since the early 2000s, though she’s avoided the stigma of being too popular. She still sounds fresh despite quite a few years in the Top 100, wearing a similar sound to Adriana and Liliana but still distinct in her own way. Also spelled Arianna, Ariana subtly squeaks by her longer form in popularity. Combined, they are more popular than you’d think, but hardly as common as Emma or Isabella.

She’s quite stylish, a name fit for a girl who loves playing dress up. Ariana is bold and brave, embracing her individualism. She’s not at all afraid to dare to be different, standing tall as a unique force among a sea of trends.

Parents also enjoy Ariana’s versatility. She comes from Latin roots, though she easily blends into other backgrounds with ease. She also comes with a host of cool nicknames like Ari, Aria, and Riana.

Her meaning is incredible for those seeking a religious name without obvious ties. She’s a subtle way to honor your faith and works well with any religion. Her meaning will remain a driving force behind her each step of the way on the journey of life.
